intro: Trichosalpinx apoda, commonly known as the naked trichosalpinx, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its unique botanical features. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is distinguished by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glabrous or nearly so, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive structure that includes a short calyx and a five-lobed corolla. Trichosalpinx apoda thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
